body:
Hey guys,

So uhm someone archived this topic about application feedback; y u archive tho?

It wasn't a flame war, and didn't deserve an archive. #unarchive 

Don't supress freedom of information :'(

Anyway I made a copy cuz I had a feeling baad things would happen.

:D
#PleaseUnarchive
#Here's the post if you want to see it


Regards,


Tortoisseeee

title: Y u archive?

replies.body: Howsie is afraid. He is. I bet you he archived it.
replies.body_tagged: Howsie is afraid. He is. I bet you he archived it.

replies.body:
Howsie Did not archive it, I did.
As I explained in my last post, No one recieved their information, and neither will he.
There is nothing left to discuss on this topic, therefore I archived it.
If you feel I made a bad decision, please feel free to rant as much as you want.
replies.body_tagged:

As I explained in my last post, No one recieved their information, and neither will he.

If you feel I made a bad decision, please feel free to rant as much as you want.

replies.body:
Woo, *rant rant rant rant rant rant*.

Glad I got that out the way! xD You could have locked it tho.

There are things left to discuss; other people could have expressed their opinions.

We're not asking for specific people to know but we're asking for everyone to receive reasoning on why they were denied.

It is unfair that other people who were denied got their reasoning and some of the current staff might have never been staff if they did not know what to change on applications.

It is unfair that other people who were denied got their reasoning and some of the current staff might have never been staff if they did not know what to change on applications.

replies.body:
What other opinions exactly? there is nothing left to be expressed.
he asked a question. And an answer was given.
There is no point in arguing here, You can lock/archive the post when you have finished thinking :)
Or you could tell me to do it, anything is fine.
replies.body_tagged:

he asked a question. And an answer was given.

replies.body:
Yo-av archiving it is not the answer, why not let users resume talking or finding alternate solutions or convincing each other that it is fair.

Other user's may give important points that could impact the decision.

Archiving is for those discussions that get out of hand due to profanity and words/pictures of a inappropriate nature not for posts that you think are useless or do not need to carry on being discussed in your mind.

replies.body:
"Yo-av archiving it is not the answer, why not let users resume talking or finding alternate solutions or convincing each other that it is fair."

I'm pretty sure he was taking advantage of the first two letters of your name, "yo". Instead of writing "Yo, yoav" he wrote "Yo-av", as in "Hi, av!" or "Hi, yoav!"

Or maybe, he just wants to say "yo-av" instead of "yoav". In the end, does it really matter? As long as it's "readable" and "recognizable" it should be fine c:
